column4: Given HP's recent support for Linux stuff, is it a safe assumption that a brand-new HP laptop would create few problems installing Breezy?
it depends on the hardware
Meaning?  Is it still totally up in the air until I know all the parts, or is there some trend to their track record?
are you looking at a specific model of laptop from HP?
I'm preparing for possibly helping a friend migrate.  Unfortunately, I haven't gotten the model information from her yet, so I don't know specifics at this time.
Does HP have anything like the IBM ThinkPad buttons, and thus something corresponding to tpb?

just about everything should work.  it's possible that very specialized hardware like infrared ports or card readers will not work properly, but ubuntu's track record on hardware support is very very good.
There is a card reader on it (one of the all-in-one types), I know that.  IR, I don't think so.  So I'll just keep that part in mind, and see if I can find anything about that part later.
Everything on my computer ran out of the box except the winmodem, which was a quick package install once I figured out what I needed, so that was all pretty sweet.

usually if the card readers are internal usb devices it works fine as usb mass storage.  with laptops there can be all kinds of weird stuff, from detecting lids being closed to screen adjustment buttons or media keys or the aforementioned fingerprint readers or broadcom wireless cards...
i'm not sure.
check the ubuntu forums
Can you change passwords from a Live CD?!?
this is what bios/bootloader passwords are for :)
And I do have that set.  Still a little bit taken aback though.
well it makes sense, doesnt it?
Well, I suppose.
You'd just have to mount the actual disk into the working live session and go from there then I suppose, right?
yeah, i'd imagine it involves chrooting a few times
But it keeps track of things smarter so it can remove metapackages.
the official policy was to recommend easyubuntu instead of automatix, but now it's pretty much just 'read the docs like you're supposed to instead of taking shortcuts'
Works for me.  (!automatix used to say that very, um, strongly.)
